This is a grossly inept analogy. First, Ethereum's smart contract usage is extremely limited. Vast majority of the data on their network is ERC20 and ERC721 tokens, neither of which require Turing completeness.

Bare multisig (OP_CHECKMULTISIG) has existed from the beginning, as were OP_IF, OP_AND and a whole host of other "smart contract" features. This myth that Ethereum somehow created smart contracts is a lie pure and simple.
Please stop perpetuating this ridiculous lie, Bitcoin has had smart contracts from the beginning. It's called Script.
